Package com.atakmap.android.user.icon

Interface IconPallet

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Icon2525cPallet, MissionSpecificPallet, SpotMapPallet, UserIconPallet, VehicleModelPallet, VehiclePallet
    public interface IconPallet
    An icon pallet that allows user to drop markers/points

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static class  IconPallet.CreatePointException  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void clearSelection​(boolean bPauseListener)
      Clear current user selection
      androidx.fragment.app.Fragment getFragment()
      Provides fragment containing the view to select point details.
      MapItem getPointPlacedIntent​(GeoPointMetaData point, java.lang.String uid)
      Generate a map item at the specified point.
      java.lang.String getTitle()
      Get title/label for this pallet
      java.lang.String getUid()
      Get unique ID for this pallet.
      void refresh()
      Indicates drop down is being displayed again, allow pallets opportunity to refresh
      void select​(int resId)
      Select an icon by resource id

    • Method Detail

      • getTitle

        java.lang.String getTitle()
        Get title/label for this pallet
        Returns:
        the human readable name for this pallet, should be shorter than 14 characters

      • getUid

        java.lang.String getUid()
        Get unique ID for this pallet.
        Returns:
        the recommended return is a UUID that has been pregenerated and remains static through the lifespan of this implementation.

      • getPointPlacedIntent

        MapItem getPointPlacedIntent​(GeoPointMetaData point,
                             java.lang.String uid)
                      throws IconPallet.CreatePointException
        Generate a map item at the specified point. Does not need to be implemented if the Fragment is responsible for all of the map interactions. Note, the intent should have a "uid" extra for the point to be created
        Parameters:
        point - the geopoint that the user selected for the point.
        Returns:
        the MapItem that is a direct result from the touch of the map.
        Throws:
        IconPallet.CreatePointException

      • getFragment

        androidx.fragment.app.Fragment getFragment()
        Provides fragment containing the view to select point details. It is suggested that this fragment fit within a 1/3 width of the screen.
        Returns:
        The Android fragment that defines this Pallet.

      • select

        void select​(int resId)
        Select an icon by resource id
        Parameters:
        resId - The button resource id or '0' if no default. For most user defined pallets, this implementation will or can be empty.

      • clearSelection

        void clearSelection​(boolean bPauseListener)
        Clear current user selection

      • refresh

        void refresh()
        Indicates drop down is being displayed again, allow pallets opportunity to refresh
